summary: This is an email exchange between two individuals, likely within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. It references personnel changes and provides contact information for a returning supervisor.

persons.name: Capone
persons.role: Chief, Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, requesting a meeting to discuss the Epstein case.

persons.name: Watson
persons.context: A former supervisor who was on an 18-month temporary duty assignment (TDY) at headquarters; the email recipient was temporarily covering their position.

connections.description: Both are associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Capone leading the Public Corruption Unit and Watson being a former supervisor.

events.title: Meeting Request on Epstein Case
events.description: Capone emails a colleague to request a meeting to discuss the Epstein case.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (NY office)
keyFacts: The email is dated June 12, 2019, indicating ongoing activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
Capone, Chief of the Public Corruption Unit in the SDNY, is directly involved in the Epstein case.
The correspondence reveals internal personnel movements (Watson's TDY and return) within the office handling the case.
The tone is informal and collegial, suggesting internal coordination among prosecutors.
